titleStmt.title: Gädlä ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; a few lines, divided into three groups alternating with black lines, on the incipit of each text; sometimes the first lines of the account proper (e.g., fols. 81vb, 84vb, 97rb, 101ra, 105va); Ethiopic numerals or their elements; elements of the punctuation signs and of coronis.

msItem.note: For each text, the equivalent pages of Budge's Edition (BConAp I, II) and the abbreviations used by Bausi in Annali 2000-2001 are given here following:
I-1) BConAp I, 3-6; BConAp II, 2-3; Int in BauGaH
I-2) BConAp I, 7-36; BConAp II, 5-25; Pt1 in BauGaH
I-3) BConAp I, 37-41, 45-49; BConAp II, 26-34; Pt2 in BauGaH
I-4) BConAp I, 42-45; BConAp II, 35-39; Pa1 in BauGaH
I-5) BConAp I, 50-66; BConAp II, 42-57; Dio in BauGaH
I-6) BConAp I, 67-70; BConAp II, 58-61; Si1 in BauGaH
I-7) BConAp I, 70-72; BConAp II, 62-64; Si2 in BauGaH
I-8) BConAp I, 73-76; BConAp II, 65-68; Jc1 in BauGaH
I-9) BConAp I, 76-82; BConAp II, 69-75; Jc2 in BauGaH
I-10) BConAp I, 307-35; BConAp II, 307-34; MAn in BauGaH
I-11) BConAp I, 336-46; 335-46; Th3 in BauGaH
I-12) BConAp I, 358-67; BConAp II, 358-65; Th5 in BauGaH
I-13) BConAp I, 368-73; BConAp II, 366-68; Th6 in BauGaH
I-14) BConAp I, 373-81; BConAp II, 376-84; Th7 in BauGaH
I-15) BConAp I, 83-92; BConAp II, 76-86; Ba1 in BauGaH
I-16) BConAp I,93-100; BConAp II, 87-92; Ba2 in BauGaH
I-17) BConAp I, 101-13; BConAp II,93-108; Mt1 in BauGaH
I-18) BConAp I, 114-18; BConAp II, 109-14; Mt2 in BauGaH
I-19) BConAp I, 119-25; BConAp II, 115-21; Luc in BauGaH
I-20) BConAp I, 126-34; BConAp II, 122-30; Ph1 in BauGaH
I-21) BConAp I, 135-39; BConAp II, 131-36; Ph2 in BauGaH
I-22) BConAp I, 140-56; BConAp II, 137-53; An1 in BauGaH
I-23) BConAp I, 184-88; BConAp II, 181-85; An2 in BauGaH
I-24) BConAp I, 156-83; BConAp II, 154-80; AnB in BauGaH
I-25) BConAp I,189-213; BConAp II,186-211; Jo1 in BauGaH
I-26)BConAp I, 214-22; BConAp II, 212-20; Jo2 in BauGaH
I-27) BConAp I, 223-24; BConAp II, 221-22; JcA in BauGaH
I-28) BConAp I, 225-42; BConAp II, 223-40; Ma1 in BauGaH
I-29) BConAp I,243-246; BConAp II, 241-45; Ma2 in BauGaH
I-30) BConAp I, 247-53; BConAp II, 246-52; JZ1 in BauGaH
I-31) BConAp I, 254-57; BConAp II, 253-56; JZ2 in BauGaH
I-32) BConAp I, 257-64; BConAp II, 257-64; Mar in BauGaH
I-33) BConAp I, 265-87; BConAp II, 265-86; Th1 in BauGaH
I-34) BConAp I, 287-95; BConAp II, 287-95; Th2 in BauGaH
I-35) BConAp I,296-306; BConAp II,296-306; Jud in BauGaH
I-36) BConAp I, 347-57; BConAp II, 347-57; Th4 in BauGaH.
- According to the distribution of the texts, the Gädlä ḥawaryat of EHPP-002would belong to IV recension (cp. BauGaH, 83-84).
Text I-3, the Martyrdom of St. Peter, does not contain the "Discourse of Peter on the Cross" (= BConAp I, 45-49; BConAp II, 30-34).
- "The Acts of St. Thomas, III" (Text I-12) are here presented as the "second": in the incipit, the numeral ፪ is used instead of ፫.
- Text I-29, on fol. 165r, is interrupted in col.a and is taken up in col.b.
- On fols. 2ra-4vb the text is written in a different hand, much more recent than the one of the most part of the text (fols.5ra-206rb).

On fol. 2v, part of the text at the end of the col.b is missing and the respective ruled lines are empty. The text on fol. 4ra is not a continuation of the previous text but it repeats the same text written on fols. 3ra–3vb.
- Fol. 198va: repeation of the incipit of "The Preaching of St. Simon the son of Cleopas, surnamed Judas or Nathaniel".
- Subscriptiones: fols. 58ra-rb, 119v, 152vb.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 206.0 folios, of which blank 1r, 1v, 75rb, 75v, 199r, 199v, 206v, in quires .
27.5 21.4 10.0

signatures.note: - Quires marks are written in pencil, in a recent hand, in the upper margin of the following fols.: fol. 12r: ፪; fol. 19r: ፫; fol. 27r: ፬; fol. 38r: ፭; fol. 46r: ፮; fol. 54r: ፯; fol. 61r: ፰; fol. 70r: ፱; fol. 77r: ፲; fol. 84r: ፲፩; fol. 92r: ፲፪; fol. 103r: ፲፫; fol. 109r: ፲፬; fol. 116r: ፲፭; fol. 125r: ፲፮; fol. 134r: ፲፯; fol. 142r: ፲፰; fol. 151r: ፲፱; fol. 158r: ፳; fol. 166r: ፳፩; fol. 176r: ፳፪; fol. 184r: ፳፫; fol. 192r: ፳፬; fol. 200r: ፳፭.

list.item: The quire structure cannot be established due to the condition of the binding. Fols. 1-3 were probably added later; fol. 103 is of a smaller size.

supportDesc.condition: Fols. 1-3 have been probably added later, in a more recent time. The Ms. was rebound. Most of the leaves are affected by humidity. Many leaves have stains in the inner upper margins (esp. fols. 133r-149v, 158r-159r, 161v-180r) and some others in the bottom margins (esp. fols. 2r-14r). Holes on fols. 57 and 151. Holes carefully repaired on fols. 48, 49, 81, 85, 182, 183, 193. Fol. 103 is of a smaller size. Fols. 132-133 are slightly damaged at the outer margins.

layout.note: Fols. 2r-3v: all data are for fol. 3r.
layout.ab: Pricking and ruling are partly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The bottom ruled line was not used by the scribe on fols. 2v-3v (on fol. 2v, two lines).

layout.note: Fols. 4r-206r: all data are for fol. 4r.
layout.ab: The number of the lines is irregular and changes between 28 and 30.
Pricking and ruling are partly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling (sometimes also below, e.g., fols. 19v-22r, 92v-94v, 95r).
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
One or two bottom ruled lines were not used by the scribe on several fols., e.g., fols. 17r, 17va, 94v, 170r, 171r, 173r, 173v, 174v, 175r, 175va, 177v.

handNote.ab: Hand a: recent, mediocre. Hand b: careful.
handNote.date: Hand a: 20th century (?). Hand b: First half of the 16th century (?).

handDesc.handNote: Hand b: fols. 4ra-206rb; first half of the 16th century (?). The letters tend to broader shapes and thick vertical lines. Some letters, e.g. መ and ወ, are angular and with triangular loops (an ancient, 14th-cent. feature); the tops of certain signs are uniformly slanted to the left.
The letter ጰ in 6th order has the vowel marker oriented to the left (s., e.g., fols. 91va, l.27, 92va, l.16).

decoNote.desc: narrow, coloured (red, yellow, green, black) ornamental band in col. a, with two pendants, one at the left upper corner and reaching l.2, one at the right bottom corner and reaching l.14 (interlaces).
narrow, coloured (red, yellow, azure, black) ornamental band over col. b, with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.5 and reaching the top of the page (interlaces).
wide, elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, green, black) ornamental band over col. a-b, with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.9 and the top of the page (interlaces).

wide, elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, green, black) ornamental band over col. a-b, with two pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.11, and decorations on the top of the band extending to the upper margin of the page (interlaces).

wide, elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, green, black) ornamental band over col. a-b, with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.13 and reaching the edges of the page. Central decoration at the top of the band. Geometric motifs (interlaces).
narrow, coloured (red, yellow, azure, green, black) ornamental band in col. b, with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.10 and l.1 (interlaces).

wide, elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, black) ornamental band over col. a-b, with two pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.10, and with decorations on the upper part of the band, extending to the top of the page, and on the bottom part of it, extending between the columns and reaching l.6. Geometric motifs (interlaces).

narrow, elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, black) ornamental band over col. b, with two pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.11, and decorations on the upper part of the band extending to the top of the page (interlaces).

wide, elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, green, black) ornamental band (partly unseen) over col. a-b, with four pendants at the corners, reaching l.6 and reaching the top of the page (interlaces).

wide, elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, green, black) ornamental band over col. a-b, with two pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.15, and with decorations on the upper part of the band, extending to the top of the page, and on the bottom part of, extending between the columns. Geometric motifs (interlaces).

wide, elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, green, black) band over col. a-b, with two pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.15, one pendant from the central bottom part of the band, extending to the bottom of the page between the columns and reaching l.20, and with decorations on the upper part of the band, extending to the top of the page. Geometric motifs (interlaces, circles).

wide, coloured (red, yellow, azure, black) ornamental band over col. a-b, with two pendants, one at the left bottom corner and reaching l.8, one at the right upper bottom corner reaching the top of the page (interlaces).

wide, elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, green, black) band over col. a-b, with two pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.13, and with decorations on the upper part of the band, extending to the top of the page, and on the bottom central part of the band, extending between the columns and reaching l.9. Geometrical motifs (interlaces, rhombs, triangles, dots).

wide, elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, green, black) ornamental band over col. a-b, with two pendants at the bottom corners, reaching l. 11 and 13, one pendant from the central bottom part of the band, extending between the columns and reaching l.8, and with decorations on the upper part of the band extending to the top of the page. Geometric motifs (interlaces, circles, triangles).

wide, elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, black) ornamental band over col. a-b, with two pendants at the bottom margins reaching l.10, and with decorations on the upper part of the band reaching the top of the page. Geometric motifs (interlaces).

wide, elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, azure, black) ornamental band over col. a-b, with two pendants at the bottom corners reaching l.12, one pendant from the central bottom part of the band, extending between the columns and reaching l.11, and with decorations on the upper part of the band extending to the top of the page. Geometric motifs (interlaces, rhombs, triangles, circles).

list.item: Fol. 28rb: List of the donors' names.Fol. 28rb: ወልደ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወለተ፡ ማርያም፡ ረምሐ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ጽላተ፡ ሙሴ፡ ወልደ፡ ሕይወት፡ ወለተ፡ ሕይወት፡ ገብረ፡ ሕይወት፡ ወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወልደ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ዘወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ መዝገብ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ገብረ፡ ኪዳን፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖተ፡ ገብረ፡ ማርያም። Fol. 28rb: Wäldä Mikaʾel, Wälättä Maryam, Rämḥa Śǝllase, Ṣǝllatä Muse, Wäldä Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Ḥǝywät, Gäbrä Ḥǝywät, Wäldä Maryam, Kidanä Maryam, Wäldä Ḥawaryat, Zä-Wäldä Maryam, Mäzgäbä Śǝllase, Gäbrä Kidan, Täklä Haymanot, Gäbrä Maryam. Written in a more recent hand (19th cent.?); parts of some names are rubricated.

Fol. 198vb: Donation note.Fol. 198vb: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘ{ግራዝማች}፡ ግደይ፡ ዘአጥረዮ፡ በንዋዩ፡ ወወሀቦ፡ ለታቦተ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ወግር፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ መድኃኒተ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወነፍስ። ዘሰረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ። ። Fol. 198vb: This (is) the book of gǝrazmač Gǝdäy which he acquired with his own money and he donated it to the tabot of (the church of) Ḥawaryat Wägr so that it might be the salvation for the flesh and soul. May the one who stole it and erased it be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul. Written in the same hand as Additio 1.

- Some of the names indicated in Additio 1 are mentioned throughout the Ms., nearly always in group of two or three. They are written, in the same hand as Additiones 1 and 2 and with the same ink, in the margins. The names are: Wäldä Ḥǝywät and Wälättä Ḥǝywät on fols. 14va, 58rb, 97rb, 107vb; Wäldä Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Ḥǝywät and Gäbrä Ḥǝywät on fols. 17ra, 19ra, 30va, 33vb, 61vb, 81va, 84va, 94rb, 100vb, 105va, 133va, 147vb, 152va, 153rb, 164ra, 171va, 188vb, 193rb, 198va. On fol. 175vb (below the text) Wäldä Ḥǝywät and Wälättä Ḥǝywät are mentioned together with Wälättä Mikaʾel and Rämḥa Śǝllase. On fol. 198va (upper margin) Kidanä Maryam is added to Wäldä Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Ḥǝywät and Gäbrä Ḥǝywät by a different hand and different ink. Besides, Wäldä Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Ḥǝywät, Wäldä Mikaʾel, Rämḥa Śǝllase, Wälättä Maryam and Ṣǝllatä Muse are mentioned below the text on fol. 206r. Others names are crudely written in pencil and in a more recent hand (esp. fols. 94r, 100v, 105v, 107v, 133v, 153r, 165r, 171v, 175v, 193r, 206r). - Corrections written over erasures, throughout the Ms.: e.g., fols. 14rb, 16rb, 26rb, 136vb. - Lacunae on fol. 67rb and on fol. 169va. Probably the space was intentionally left empty, to be filled with ornamental bands later. In the blank spaces, a few black dots are visible possibly done as preliminary design for the ornamental bands (which were never executed). The lacunae are present in other parts of the Ms., e.g., on fols. 30vb, 34rab, 61vb, 67rb, 94vab, 147vb, 189ra, 193vab. - Crude notes and drawings in pencil are in the margins of fols. 30v, 57v, 82r and 156r. - Compressed script has been used for some of the corrections made by the scribe throughout the Ms. (e.g., fols. 35va, 137va, 137vb, 140va, 139vb, 177ra, 192va.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; leather inlays (a parchment pastedown is visible on the inner side of the back board; possibly there are remains of a parchment pastedown also on the inner side of the front board). Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of endband stitches through the spine cover. Most of the quires are reinforced by parchment guards of different length (or by strips of black cotton cloth).
Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 3 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, wave form).

origin.origDate: First half of the 16th cent. (?). Fols. 1-3 are maybe of a recent time (20th cent.?).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Additio 2 (written in a 19th-cent. hand?) mentions gǝrazmač Gǝdäy as the donor of the book. Names of other individuals are listed in Additio 1 (fol. 28rb): Wäldä Mikaʾel, Wälättä Maryam, Rämḥa Śǝllase, Ṣǝllatä Muse, Wäldä Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Ḥǝywät, Gäbrä Ḥǝywät, Wäldä Maryam, Kidanä Maryam, Wäldä Ḥawaryat, Zä-Wäldä Maryam, Mäzgäbä Śǝllase, Gäbrä Kidan, Täklä Haymanot, Gäbrä Maryam. The names of Wäldä Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Ḥǝywät and Gäbrä Ḥǝywät are also written throughout the Ms., most of the times all three, sometimes two of them (s. “Varia”).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
